Q2d_measured_predicted_Scheveningen.name: name
Q2d_measured_predicted_Scheveningen.question: As you can see the tidal signal doesn't perfectly match the observed sea level. What factors could contribute to the differences between the observed water level records and the FES2014 tidal signal?

feedback.correct: Correct. Have a look at Figure 1.12 in the book to better understand meteorological effects.
feedback.incorrect: Incorrect. Are shallow-water tides included in FES2014? And meteorological effects? What are common sources of error?

Q2d_beating_formula.name: name
Q2d_beating_formula.question: What is the equation number in the book that you need to compute the beating period of two harmonic constituents? Type 1.11a for Equation (1.11a).

feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, please try again. Wave groups are dealt with in Section 3.5.3.

Q2d_M2_S2_phenomenon.name: name
Q2d_M2_S2_phenomenon.question: Select only the main semi-diurnal components M2 and S2 and set the time range to around 30 days. Which phenomenon can you detect when looking at the combined signal of these two?

feedback.correct: Correct. Compare this to what you have learnt in notebook 2c about the spring-neap tide cycle. Note: verify for Scheveningen that M2 and S2 are indeed the main semi-diurnal components.

Q2d_M2_S2_period.name: name
Q2d_M2_S2_period.question: What is the period of the beating of the combined signal of M2 and S2? The beating period of M2 and S2 in days is (use 4 significant figures):

feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, please try again. Did you use the periods as in the Table in this notebook? These are more accurate than the periods in the corresponding table in the textbook. Did you give your answer in four significant figures?

Q2d_M2_K1_phenomenon.name: name
Q2d_M2_K1_phenomenon.question: Now select the M2 and the main diurnal components K1 and O1. Look at a few consecutive high and low waters in the combined signal, which phenomenon can you detect? Give the name of this phenomenon:

Q2d_M2_K1_period.name: name
Q2d_M2_K1_period.question: Can you explain this phenomenon from the beating period of M2 with these diurnal components? Compute the beating period for the diurnal component with the largest amplitude for Scheveningen. Provide your answer in days (use four significant figures).

feedback.incorrect: Incorrect, please try again. Did you notice that the diurnal component with the largest amplitude at Scheveningen is not the one with the largest amplitude according to equilibrium theory? Did you use the periods as in the table in this notebook? These are more accurate than the periods in the corresponding table in the textbook. Did you give your answer in four significant figures?
